Key Match Events: Malik Monk led the Sacramento Kings with a season-high 31 points, shooting 6-of-12 from beyond the arc.
Monk scored 11 of his 31 points in the fourth quarter to help close out the game.
The Kings shot 21-of-47 from beyond the arc with seven players making a three-pointer.
DeMar DeRozan made four three-pointers on seven attempts.
Trey Lyles shot a perfect 4-for-4 from deep off the bench.
Jaylen Wells of the Memphis Grizzlies scored a career-high 30 points on 8-of-9 shooting.
Post-Match Reflections: The Kings matched or exceeded the Grizzlies' physicality throughout the game.
De'Aaron Fox was called for a flagrant foul on Scotty Pippen Jr.
Jaren Jackson Jr. was called for a flagrant foul when he hip-checked Fox going up for a dunk.
The Kings are finding their identity as a team that outworks their opponents.
